snippet: Fewer than a dozen House Republicans have publicly said they would back President Obama on a military strike, making the White House climb to a House majority steep.
abstract: Fewer than a dozen House Republicans have publicly said they would back Pres Obama on a military strike in Syria, making the administration's climb to House majority steep.

byline.original: By JOHN HARWOOD and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: John Harwood reported from Midwest City, and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Fewer than a dozen House Republicans have publicly said they would back President Obama on a military strike, making the White House climb to a House majority steep.

headline.main: House Republicans Say Voters Oppose Intervention
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Say Voters Oppose Intervention
